full_text: Biehl face pees Beer IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2020/KERIA78 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON TUESDAY, THE 07TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 17TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(C) AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 1195/2014 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, MANNARKAD CRIME NO.459/2014 OF KALLADIKKODE POLICE STATION , Palakkad PETITIONER/S: JAFER ALI AGED 29 YEARS S/O. HUSSAN, AANAPPALLIYALIL HOUSE, KALLADIKKODE, PALAKKAD. BY ADVS. SHRI .SARATH M.S. SRI.VYSAKH VIJAYAN SMT.NIVEA LIZ PETER FERNANDEZ RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE S I OF POLICE, KALLADIKKODE POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD, THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2 UMMARUL FAROOQUE, AGED 39, S/O. IMBICHIKOYATHANGAL, KALLADIKKODE, PALAKKAD. OTHER PRESENT: SMT. N.K.PUSHPALATHA, PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: seus Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 2 2020/KERIA78 ORDER Dated this the 7th day of January 2020 The petitioner is the 3' accused in Crime No.459/2014 of Kalladikkode Police Station for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 341 and 324 r/w Section 34 IPC along with two others. The parent case was taken on file by the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad as CC No.1195/2014. The trial proceeded and both of them were found not guilty and acquitted under Section 248(1) of Cr.P.C. The case against the 3 accused was split up and refiled as CC No.456/2017 as he was absconding. The petitioner now approached this Court with a prayer to quash the proceedings against him in view of the acquittal of the co-accused. 2. A reading of the judgment in CC No.1195/2014 indicates that even the prime witness had turned hostile and it is specifically stated by the witness examined as PW1, that he has mentioned the name of the accused in Ext.P1 FIS only on the basis of some misunderstanding. The judgment has now become final. No purpose will be served by proceeding with the trial against the petitioner. De sreNe) pee pa Crl.MC.No.7548 OF 2019(c) 3 2020/KERIA78 In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire proceedings in CC No.456/2017 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Mannarkkad stands quashed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. and the accused is discharged.
